Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s Night Of The Living Dead from back in 1968 proved that there was a market for zombie-themed exploitation films, but it would be plenty of years before more cinematic undead crawlers would transform our most beloved life forms onto film.

Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement on all local matters for debate, while demanding moral superiority over those it finds wanting. The Dutch simply react with an even deeper sense of underlying arrogance and apathetic contempt for anything that bores them. These two things make for common opinions yet barely congruent beliefs or convictions
